string: 艾莉西弗的贵族威仪

string: 艾莉西弗的幻象

original: Elisif's Illusion
string: 艾莉西弗的幻象

original: Marker Storage Unit
string: 标记存储单元

original: There are villains who'd use your Dragonborn status to challenge the Emperor's legitimacy. Good thing you're already on our side.
string: 有些恶徒会利用你龙裔的身份来质疑皇帝的合法性.幸好你早已站在我们这边.

original: Gaining the Greybeards' approval will cement your legitimacy. You could be even more of a rallying figure to the Legion and Solitude's guards.
string: 获得灰胡子的认可将巩固你的合法性.你甚至可能成为军团和独孤城卫兵更强大的凝聚核心.

original: Whoever stole the Greybeards' horn have little respect for the sages. They don't care for rules and repercussions, and that makes them dangerous.
string: 盗走灰胡子号角之人对圣贤毫无敬意.他们无视规则与后果,这使他们变得危险.

original: There was a blade in Delphine's room - familiar, yet foreign. Did I see it in... Cloud Ruler Temple, back near Bruma?
string: 戴尔芬的房间里有一把剑--既熟悉又陌生.我是不是在......云顶神殿见过它?就在布鲁玛附近.

original: I understand the mission's necessity... But remember your station in the Legion. One misstep in the Embassy, and there will be a diplomatic disaster.
string: 我明白这次任务的必要性......但请记住你在军团中的身份.在大使馆稍有差池,就会引发外交灾难.

original: I remember my first sight of Cloud Ruler Temple - even in ruin, it held me awestruck for hours. Now its silent stones alone mourn the Blades' fate.
string: 我仍记得初见云顶神殿时的震撼--即便已成废墟,它依然让我敬畏地驻足数小时.如今,唯有那些沉默的石块,为刀锋卫士的命运哀悼.

original: Sky Haven Temple still looks pristine after all the eons. Perhaps Akaviri magicks are still clinging to its stones.
string: 天空圣殿历经万古岁月,看起来依然完好如初.或许是阿卡维尔的魔法仍依附在它的石壁上.

original: I didn't suffer Erikur and the monsters out here just to see the world run its course and end. You've taught even the Greybeards a lesson there.
string: 我忍受艾瑞库尔和这里的怪物,可不是为了眼睁睁看着世界按部就班走向终结.在这方面,你连灰胡子都教训过了.

original: It's relieving that peaceful dragons exist. If they can be reasoned with, then treaties and alliances become possible.
string: 存在和平的巨龙令人宽慰.倘若能与它们理性沟通,那么缔结条约与联盟便成为可能.

original: Some seek the Elder Scroll to know their fate, but what if it shows only despair? Better stay unknowing - then fight to change it.
string: 有人追寻上古卷轴以窥探命运,但若它只昭示绝望呢?不如保持未知--然后奋力去改变它.

original: The World-Eater takes flight as soon as he tastes of defeat, yet he mocks us for our mortality. You are stronger than him, and I know you will win.
string: 世界吞噬者一尝败绩便振翅而逃,却还嘲笑我等凡人之躯.你比他更强大,我知道你终将获胜.

original: We've reasoned with Paarthurnax before. I've no doubt you can work your charm on Odahviing all the same.
string: 我们以前也和帕图纳克斯沟通过.我相信你同样能对奥杜因施展你的魅力.

original: That man enlists the first soul he comes across to do his unsavory work. I'd say he's more desperate than us.
string: 那人随便抓个路过的灵魂就派去做肮脏勾当,我看他比我们更走投无路.

original: You condemn an innocent at a brute's command, then you extort my subjects! When did my noble protector become this craven extortionist?
string: 你听从一个暴徒的命令谴责无辜者,然后勒索我的臣民!我高贵的守护者何时变成了如此卑劣的敲诈者?

original: The Guild may command your hands, but your loyalty belongs to the crown. Forget this truth, and I shall find one who remembers.
string: 公会或许能驱使你的双手,但你的忠诚应归于王权.若忘记此理,我自会寻得铭记之人.

original: Maven Black-Briar - mistress of the Thieves Guild and architect of Riften's ruin. Since when do criminals buy thrones?
string: 玛雯.黑棘--盗贼公会的主母,裂谷城衰败的幕后推手.从何时起,罪犯也能买下王座了?

original: To think such corruption festers unchecked in my city, while my guards turn blind eyes... Were Aldis not my confidant, I'd purge the entire garrison.
string: 想不到这等腐败竟在我的城市里肆意滋生,而我的卫兵却视而不见......若非阿尔迪斯是我的心腹,我定要将整个卫队清洗一空.

original: Mercer Frey is a thief, a murderer, and a craven. Except this time, no Guild will save him from the noose.
string: 墨瑟.弗雷是个窃贼,杀人犯,还是个懦夫.但这一次,盗贼公会可没法把他从绞刑架上救下来了.

original: You gave me your oath... And now you give it again to a Daedra. What if your new mistress demands you to betray your queen?
string: 你曾向我立下誓言......如今却将这份忠诚再度献给一位迪德拉.若你的新主母命你背叛女王,你又当如何?

original: The die is cast. The traitor is dead, yet Nocturnal holds your fate hostage. There's no escaping that Daedra now.
string: 木已成舟.叛徒已死,但诺克图娜尔仍将你的命运攥在手中.如今已无法逃脱那位迪德拉的掌控.

original: From a royal protector to the Companions' errand-runner? My, your career has taken an... interesting turn. I jest, of course.
string: 从皇家护卫到战友团的跑腿小弟?呵,你的职业生涯可真是...转了个有趣的弯.当然,我只是开个玩笑.

original: It seems the Companions finally recognize your worth beyond menial tasks. Good for you, and even better for them.
string: 看来战友团终于认可了你不止能做杂活的价值.这对你是好事,对他们更是如此.

original: I would never have thought Skyrim's most venerated warriors were... I'll need time to adjust to that.
string: 我从未想过天际省最受尊敬的战士竟是......我需要些时间来适应这个事实.

original: You may have become a beast, but I know your heart still pulses with honor, just as the others. You have your future queen's faith, as always.
string: 你或许已化身为野兽,但我深知你的心仍如其他人一样搏动着荣誉.你一如既往,拥有未来女王的信任.

original: Sybille once spoke of the Reachmen's dark arts, even the Glenmoril Coven's profane rituals. There was almost a hint of... envy in her tone.
string: 西比尔曾谈及瑞驰人的黑暗技艺,乃至格伦摩利女巫团的亵渎仪式.她的语气中几乎带着一丝......羡慕.

original: These Silver Hand call themselves werewolf hunters, yet their deeds reek of common brigandage. If Whiterun's Jarl won't deal with them, then we will.
string: 这些银手自称是狼人猎手,可他们的行径却散发着普通强盗的恶臭.如果白漫城的领主不处理他们,那就由我们来解决.

original: I may not be born in Skyrim... But being here, in the tomb of my mother's most venerated ancestor? There is something profoundly moving in that.
string: 我或许并非生于天际...但此刻,身处我母亲最崇敬的先祖之墓中?这其中蕴含着某种深沉的感动.

original: Sybille dismissed the vampires as a minor nuisance, but it seems these Dawnguard believe otherwise.
string: 西比尔莱认为吸血鬼只是小麻烦,但黎明守卫似乎不这么想.

original: These vampires threaten my subjects. Whatever their goal is, I will not tolerate their predation.
string: 这些吸血鬼威胁着我的臣民.无论他们有何目的,我都不会容忍他们的掠夺行径.

original: A vampire castle so close to Haafingar, yet not a Jarl before me had acted? Were they afraid, or had the vampires deceived our eyes?
string: 一座吸血鬼城堡离海芬加如此之近,而我之前的领主们竟无一人采取行动?他们是害怕了,还是吸血鬼蒙蔽了我们的双眼?

original: You traded your soul to join those monsters? Power I might understand... but this grotesque transformation? What pitiful reward.
string: 你竟为加入那些怪物而出卖灵魂?追求力量尚可理解......但这般畸形的转变?何等可悲的回报.

original: I lost my parents when I was only twelve, but their smiles have always stayed with me. I pity Serana... She will never get that back from Molag Bal.
string: 我十二岁就失去了双亲,但他们的笑容一直留在我心中.我可怜瑟拉娜......她永远无法从莫拉格.巴尔那里夺回那份温暖.

original: If one comfort exists in this accursed place, it is knowing Torygg dwells honored in Sovngarde's halls - not trapped in this profane darkness.
string: 如果说这被诅咒之地尚存一丝慰藉,那便是知晓托依格安息于松加德的殿堂--而非困于这亵渎的黑暗之中.

original: This vale may fall within my sovereignty... but I would rather leave such beauty untouched forever.
string: 这片山谷虽属我治下疆域......但我宁愿让它的美永远保持原貌,不受侵扰.

original: I charge you with bringing down Harkon and restoring hope to Skyrim, my Champion. May Akatosh's light guide your hand.
string: 我命令你击败哈孔,为天际重燃希望,我的勇士.愿阿卡托什的光芒指引你的利刃.

original: Those cultists mentioned the "true" Dragonborn... But who could that be? Is he another Septim, coming to reclaim his throne?
string: 那些邪教徒提到了'真正的'龙裔......但那会是谁呢?是另一位赛普汀,前来夺回他的王座吗?

original: I feel an ominous power here. It's as if a whisper is trying to crush my mind, make me do its bidding... You are the only thing keeping me sane.
string: 我在这里感受到一股不祥的力量.仿佛有低语试图碾碎我的意志,迫使我服从它的命令......只有你能让我保持清醒.

original: Miraak's whispers invade my thoughts still, full of jealousy and sadism. He wants to... possess me, make Skyrim's queen his slave.
string: 米拉克的低语仍在我脑海中萦绕,充满了嫉妒与施虐欲.他想要......占有我,让天际的女王成为他的奴隶.

original: As we free Solstheim's stones from Miraak's control, I can feel his whispers growing silent. Whatever sorceries he consorts with, he won't have me.
string: 随着我们将索瑟海姆的巨石从米拉克的控制中解放出来,我能感觉到他的低语逐渐沉寂.无论他施展何种巫术,都无法控制我.

original: The sooner we destroy Miraak, the sooner I can have the peace of mind again. Quite literally.
string: 我们越早消灭米拉克,我就能越早重获内心的平静.字面意义上的平静.

original: Hermaeus Mora might show you the means to destroy Miraak... But at what price? Your soul? Your morality? Your very life?
string: 赫麦尤斯.莫拉或许会向你展示消灭米拉克的方法......但代价是什么?你的灵魂?你的道德?还是你的生命本身?

original: I believe in you. Dragonborn or not, you command true power and determination. Go with my blessing and conquer Apocrypha in your future queen's name.
string: 我相信你.无论你是否是龙裔,你都拥有真正的力量与决心.带着我的祝福去吧,以你未来女王之名征服异典.

original: In Skyrim or Morrowind, politics is always a cutthroat business. Either you stab someone in the back... or you hide.
string: 在天空省或晨风省,政治永远是残酷的勾当.要么你在背后捅人一刀......要么你就躲起来.

original: Had the Vici owned the East Empire Company in those days, they would've annexed Raven Rock already. The mine's closure may be a blessing in disguise.
string: 如果当年维齐家族掌控了东帝国公司,他们早就吞并鸦石镇了.矿场的关闭或许因祸得福.

original: The East Empire Company once existed for Tamriel's prosperity. Now, its only purpose is to exert control - not for the Empire, but for House Vici.
string: 东帝国公司曾为泰姆瑞尔的繁荣而存在.如今,其唯一目的便是施加控制--并非为了帝国,而是为了维希家族.

original: Having lost my beloved once... I will cherish every moment with you this time.
string: 曾经失去过挚爱一次......这一次,我会珍惜与你共度的每一刻.

original: My court would have me marry for alliances, but I'd rather choose someone I respect and love. And I'm glad I did.
string: 我的宫廷希望我为联盟而联姻,但我宁愿选择自己敬重并爱慕的人.我很庆幸自己做到了.

original: Alduin is no more, and Ulfric is gone. Our kingdom can finally begin to heal.
string: 奥杜因已逝,乌弗瑞克也已不在.我们的王国终于可以开始愈合了.

original: If you hadn't come to Solstheim, who knows how many would've fallen to Miraak's slavery? What you did in Apocrypha has secured all our will.
string: 若不是你来到索瑟海姆,天知道还有多少人会沦为米拉克的奴隶?你在湮灭领域所做的一切,捍卫了我们所有人的自由意志.

original: Miraak would've enslaved Solstheim, and yet you allied with him? How do you sleep, knowing he could warp your thoughts like he tried with mine?
string: 米拉克本会奴役索瑟海姆,而你却与他结盟?明知他曾试图扭曲我的思想,也可能扭曲你的,你如何能安睡?

original: For all the dirty dealings of the Vici, Raven Rock couldn't have sunken lower. With their gold, this town may see light again.
string: 尽管维齐家族行事卑劣,但鸦石镇已堕落至无可复加.或许凭借他们的黄金,这座城镇能重见光明.

original: I applaud the Companions' neutrality. The Legion can't have every fighter, after all - some must remain and hunt the bandits and beasts out there.
string: 我赞赏战友团的立场中立.毕竟军团不可能网罗所有战士--总得有人留下来清剿那些强盗和野兽.

original: Skyrim's bards shall sing of the Companions as heroes. Your secrets are safe as long as I rule.
string: 天际的吟游诗人将传唱战友团的英雄事迹.只要我统治一日,你们的秘密就安全无虞.

original: The College houses many great sorcerers. It's a pity the rest of our kingdom rarely benefits from their art.
string: 学院里住着许多伟大的法师.可惜我们王国的其他地方很少能从他们的技艺中受益.

original: With the lives the Thalmor have taken here, I can promise you - Skyrim will demand answers from Alinor.
string: 鉴于梭默在此地夺走的生命,我可以向你保证--天际省必将向阿利诺尔讨个说法.

original: I may dress as an adventurer, but this hovel still insults my dignity. Ugh! If only I didn't have to learn the underworld's ways.
string: 我虽身着冒险者的装束,但这陋室仍是对我尊严的侮辱.唉!若我不必学习地下世界的行事方式该多好.

original: It's good to have the Guild Master's loyalty - someone unafraid to sully their hands for their queen.
string: 能得到公会长的忠诚真是太好了--一个为了女王不惜弄脏双手的人.

original: Jarl Balgruuf is a pragmatist. It didn't surprise me at all when he chose the Empire.
string: 巴尔古夫领主是个务实派.他选择帝国阵营,我一点也不意外.

original: Whiterun's fertile plains and extensive trade routes are Skyrim's greatest assets. Whatever the price, they must be secured.
string: 白漫城肥沃的平原与发达的贸易路线是天际省最宝贵的财富.无论付出何种代价,都必须确保它们的安全.

original: When we secured Whiterun from the rebellion, the Civil War was already won.
string: 当我们从叛乱中确保了白漫城的安全时,内战其实已经胜利了.

original: Solitude is the crown jewel of our kingdom. Her beauty and prosperity must be preserved.
string: 孤独城是我们王国的璀璨明珠.她的美丽与繁荣必须得以维系.

original: Though I came to Solitude only a decade ago, I feel like I've been here all my life.
string: 虽然我十年前才来到独孤城,却感觉仿佛一生都在此度过.

original: Solitude houses Skyrim's busiest harbor, though really, most ships it receives are of the East Empire Company.
string: 独孤城拥有天际省最繁忙的港口,不过实际上,它接待的船只大多属于东帝国公司.

original: Even with Ulfric gone, this city still harbors disdain for the Empire.
string: 即便乌弗瑞克已不在,这座城市依然对帝国心怀鄙夷.

original: The Imperial troops have enforced martial law in Windhelm, from what I hear. But it will only sow the seeds for further rebellion, not peace.
string: 据我所知,帝国军队已在风盔城实行了戒严.但这只会播下更多叛乱的种子,而非和平.

original: Windhelm still harbors resentment for Imperial rule. Jarl Brunwulf will need stronger hands to set things right.
string: 风舵城对帝国统治仍怀怨恨.布伦武夫领主需要更强硬的手段来拨乱反正.

original: This city is a cesspit of crime and lawlessness. If things go on like this, its people will never know peace.
string: 这座城市是犯罪与无法无天的污秽之地.若情况继续如此,其居民将永无宁日.

original: The Thieves Guild may be scoundrels and cutpurses, but even a queen may find uses for such... specific talents.
string: 盗贼公会或许尽是些恶棍扒手,但即便是女王,也可能用得上这般......特殊才能.

original: The Thanes told me Maven had the grace of a Vici. I suppose they weren't exaggerating.
string: 领主们告诉我玛雯有着维齐家族的风范.看来他们并非夸大其词.

original: The Thanes never told me much about Markarth. I now see why.
string: 领主们从未向我透露太多关于马卡斯城的事.现在我明白原因了.

original: Can you believe it? This gods-forsaken city was where Ulfric started his bloody war.
string: 你能相信吗?这座被诸神遗弃的城市,正是乌弗瑞克发动那场血腥战争的地方.

original: With this city's chaos, I fear another war is already brewing here. Nothing good ever comes out of Markarth.
string: 看这城市的混乱局面,恐怕另一场战争已在此地酝酿.马卡斯城从来不会带来什么好事.

original: Dragon Bridge may be a charming hamlet, but in wartime, it becomes a vital chokepoint.
string: 龙桥镇或许是个迷人的小村庄,但在战争时期,它却成了一个至关重要的咽喉要地.

original: Let's do our best to avoid conflicts here. If these Thalmor see through my amulet's magic, then it could mean a diplomatic disaster... or far worse.
string: 我们尽量在这里避免冲突.如果这些梭默看穿我护符上的魔法,那可能会引发外交灾难......甚至更糟.

original: If you have to deal with these Thalmor - do it clean and leave no one to report it. Skyrim does not need another war yet.
string: 如果你必须对付这些梭默人--务必处理干净,不留活口回去报信.天际省现在还不需要再打一场战争.

original: I thought to tour Skyrim with you, and you took me to these exotic lands. Not that I disapprove.
string: 我本想与你同游天际,你却带我来到这些异域之地.倒也不是不赞同.

original: Torygg's great-great-grandfather gifted Solstheim to the Dunmer. It was a wise diplomatic move.
string: 托依格的曾曾祖父将索瑟姆赠予了丹莫,这是一项明智的外交举措.

original: Solstheim's cruel climate scorns all life - yet the Dunmer endure its ashes, and the Skaal thrive in its storms.
string: 索瑟海姆的严酷气候藐视一切生命--然而丹莫在灰烬中坚忍,斯卡尔人在风暴中繁盛.

original: Solstheim feels like a world away from Skyrim, but it takes less than a day's sail to come here.
string: 索瑟海姆感觉像是远离天际省的另一个世界,但乘船不到一天就能抵达这里.

original: Had Ulfric won the war, I've no doubt he would attempt to "reconquer" Solstheim, wasting lives to prove his doomed cause.
string: 如果乌弗瑞克赢了这场战争,我毫不怀疑他会试图'重新征服'索瑟海姆,用无谓的牺牲来证明他那注定失败的事业.

original: It's interesting to see a place that isn't ruled by a Nord or an Imperial.
string: 能看到一个既不由诺德人也不由帝国人统治的地方,真是有趣.

original: Even in Solstheim's harshness, the Dunmer grin their teeth and persevere because they must. That's worth learning from.
string: 即使在索瑟海姆的严酷环境中,黑暗精灵们也咬紧牙关坚持,因为他们别无选择.这值得学习.

original: The Telvanni were almost destroyed by the Argonian invaders decades ago, but still they pressed on.
string: 泰尔瓦尼家族几十年前几乎被亚龙人入侵者摧毁,但他们依然坚持了下来.

original: If I hadn't witnessed these criminals with my own eyes, such transgressions would never have reached my ears.
string: 若非我亲眼所见,这等罪行绝不会传入我的耳中.

original: When I take the throne, aiding my vassals against these brigands will be my first priority.
string: 待我登基之后,首要之事便是协助封臣剿灭这些匪徒.

original: These brigands treat our laws as worthless as dust. Today is the day they meet their queen's justice.
string: 这些强盗视我们的法律如尘土般一文不值.今天就是他们领受女王裁决之日.

original: When I assume my rightful place as Queen, villains such as these bandits will be purged to the last man.
string: 当我登上应得的王位时,像这些强盗一样的恶徒将被彻底清除,一个不留.

original: These Forsworn butchers thrived under the Jarl of Markarth's watch. Perhaps he needs a demonstration on how a leader cleans house.
string: 这些弃誓者屠夫在马克拉斯的领主眼皮底下猖獗.或许他需要见识一下,真正的领袖该如何清理门户.

original: It's saddening to see that the Forsworn are beyond reasoning. Negotiations might be a vain attempt at this point.
string: 看到弃誓者已经无法理喻,实在令人痛心.此刻进行谈判或许只是徒劳之举.

original: When Ulfric completed his bloody conquest of Markarth, he inflicted a wound that no passage of time could heal.
string: 当乌弗瑞克完成他对马卡斯城的血腥征服时,他留下了一道时间也无法愈合的创伤.

original: The Dwemer would have been uneasy neighbors at best, and terrible foes at worst. Thank the Divines that they're no more.
string: 矮人充其量不过是令人不安的邻居,最糟时则是可怕的敌人.感谢众神他们已不复存在.

original: If we arm our soldiers with these Dwemer technologies, then no army will be our rival.
string: 如果我们的士兵装备上这些矮人科技,那么将没有军队能与我们匹敌.

original: I wonder if the Dwemer researched on agriculture too? Knowledge like that could breathe life into Skyrim's harshest soils.
string: 我在想,矮人是否也研究过农业?那样的知识或许能让天际最贫瘠的土地焕发生机.

original: The Falmer's hatred runs so deep, that even the Divines' mercy is soured.
string: 雪精灵的仇恨如此之深,连众神的慈悲都为之变质.

original: The Falmer failed to overthrow their Dwemer oppressors, and now they've become wretches skulking in the dark. I will not share their fate.
string: 雪精灵未能推翻他们的锻莫压迫者,如今已沦为在黑暗中潜行的可怜虫.我绝不会重蹈他们的覆辙.

original: If the Falmer never started a war against Ysgramor, perhaps they would still exist as their graceful selves.
string: 如果雪精灵当初没有对伊斯格拉谟发动战争,或许他们至今仍能保持优雅的本貌.

original: The Draugr crypts remind me of the Ayleid ruins. They bear nothing but dark omens.
string: 这些尸鬼墓穴让我想起了亚历德遗迹,它们只预示着黑暗的预兆.

original: The dead frighten me... But not when my protector is around.
string: 死人让我害怕...但有我的守护者在身边时就不怕了.

original: You taught me not just combat skills, but also how to overcome my fear.
string: 你不仅教会了我战斗技巧,还教会了我如何克服恐惧.

original: It's probably unbecoming of the future Queen to disturb the ancestors' rest. Fortunately, no one needs to be the wiser.
string: 打扰先人安息,恐怕有失未来女王的身份.幸好,此事无需让旁人知晓.

original: These mages held the power to mend Skyrim's wounds, yet they chose to delve into darkness. By my authority - I charge you to end their corruption.
string: 这些法师本有能力治愈天际的创伤,却选择沉沦黑暗.以我的权威--我命令你终结他们的腐化.

original: These dark mages flout our laws, thinking their sorceries make them invincible. By my decree, they will all face execution.
string: 这些黑暗法师藐视我们的律法,以为他们的法术能让他们无敌.依我之令,他们都将被处决.

original: Magic should build cities and cure diseases, not summon Daedra and desecrate the dead.
string: 魔法应当用于建造城市和治愈疾病,而非召唤迪德拉与亵渎死者.

original: I can stop the vampire menace across Skyrim, once I gain control of Solitude's armies.
string: 一旦我掌控了独孤城的军队,就能彻底清除天际省的吸血鬼威胁.

original: Solitude was once plagued by a vampire coven from Hammerfell. Now these villains can only cower in the shadows.
string: 独孤城曾一度饱受来自落锤省的吸血鬼教派侵扰.如今这些恶徒只能龟缩在阴影之中.

original: I wonder if we could study the vampires, and learn how to halt their curse before it takes root.
string: 我在想,我们能否研究一下吸血鬼,找出在他们诅咒根深蒂固之前将其遏止的方法.

original: If anyone still questions my legitimacy, I will invite them to witness this dragon's corpse.
string: 若还有人质疑我的正统性,我便请他们来亲眼见证这具巨龙的遗骸.

original: Must we really pick a fight with the dragon? I may have asked you to train me, but this is too much.
string: 我们真的非得去招惹那条龙吗?我虽然请你训练我,但这未免太过火了.

original: I've never seen a giant before I traveled with you. This has really been eye-opening.
string: 在与你同行之前,我从未见过巨人.这真是让我大开眼界.

original: I wonder if the giants can talk? They could make mighty guardsmen if we can somehow win their loyalty.
string: 我在想,巨人会不会说话?如果我们能赢得他们的忠诚,他们或许能成为强大的守卫.

original: I enjoyed watching the rain from my quarters. It's quite different when I'm actually in the rain.
string: 我喜欢从住处看雨.真正置身雨中时,感觉就大不相同了.

original: May there be rainbow after the rain.
string: 愿雨后终见彩虹.

original: The sun lightens my day.
string: 阳光点亮了我的日子.

original: Skyrim's beauty is unmatched by anything, especially when the sun shines bright on her.
string: 天际的美景无与伦比,尤其是当阳光明媚地照耀在她身上时.

original: The clouds are pregnant with rain.
string: 乌云密布,大雨将至.

original: The stars are shy tonight.
string: 今晚的星星有些害羞.

original: The stars lighten our path.
string: 星星照亮了我们的道路.

original: Look at the stars, shimmering and dancing. They're cheering for us.
string: 看那些星星,闪烁着,舞动着.它们在为我们欢呼.

original: The aurora are like a fine melody, composed by the Divines.
string: 极光如同神圣谱写的优美旋律.

original: The aurora was a rare occurrence back in Bruma. In Skyrim? I can have it as much as I want.
string: 在布鲁玛,极光可是难得一见的景象.在天际省?我想看就能看到.

original: I hear you are serving under General Tullius as a Legionnaire, my friend. It pleases me that you've chosen a good cause.
string: 听说你以军团士兵的身份在图留斯将军麾下效力,我的朋友.很高兴你选择了一项正义的事业.

original: It would please me even more if you could keep me informed on the frontline's news from time to time.
string: 如果你能时不时向我通报前线的最新消息,我会更加高兴.

original: Why are you interested in the frontline's news?
string: 你为什么对前线的消息感兴趣?

original: The Legion is out there fighting for my kingdom's reunification; in a sense, they're also fighting for my right as Skyrim's queen.
string: 军团正在为我的王国统一而战;从某种意义上说,他们也是在为我作为天际女王的权利而战.

original: The least I could do is to know what's happening out there... and say my prayers for you and your brothers-in-arms' safety.
string: 我至少也该了解外面的情况......并为你和战友们的平安祈祷.

original: If General Tullius isn't telling you anything, then it's not my place to do so.
string: 如果图留斯将军没告诉你,那我也无权透露.

original: I see... It's a pity you see it that way. In that case, I bid you safety and a swift victory, my friend.
string: 我明白了......很遗憾你这样想.既然如此,我祝你一路平安,早日凯旋,我的朋友.

original: As you wish, Jarl Elisif.
string: 如您所愿,艾莉西弗领主.

original: Thank you, Champion. Akatosh watch over you.
string: 谢谢你,冠军.阿卡托什会庇佑你的.

original: Let's talk about something else.
string: 我们聊点别的吧.

original: About news from the frontline...
string: 关于前线的消息......

original: Yes, Champion? What news from the front?
string: 是的,冠军?前线有什么消息?

original: We've secured Whiterun from the rebellion.
string: 我们已经从叛乱中确保了白漫城的安全.

original: Excellent. Whiterun is not only Skyrim's center of commerce, but also the heart of its food supply.
string: 很好.白漫城不仅是天际省的经济中心,也是其粮食供应的核心.

original: By protecting it from the rebellion's ravage, we've prevented starvation for much of Skyrim. You have my gratitude.
string: 通过保护它免受叛乱的蹂躏,我们避免了天际省大部分地区的饥荒.我对此深表感激.

original: We've lost Falkreath.
string: 我们失去了佛克瑞斯.

original: It's a shame. Falkreath is the gateway to Cyrodiil, and losing it means supplies and soldiers must reach Skyrim through High Rock or by sea.
string: 很遗憾.佛克瑞斯是通往赛洛迪尔的门户,失去它意味着补给和士兵必须通过高岩或海路才能抵达天际.

original: Both of which require dealing with Hammerfell... which is less than ideal, considering the turbulent situation with the Redguards.
string: 这两者都牵涉到与落锤省打交道......考虑到红卫人动荡不安的局势,这实在算不上理想.

original: But I believe you've tried your best. Now, I must rely on you to retake Falkreath for us.
string: 但我相信你已经尽力了.现在,我必须依靠你为我们夺回佛克瑞斯.

original: We've lost the Reach.
string: 我们失去了瑞驰.

original: It'll be troublesome to fund our armies without the Reach's silver... And on the other side, the Reachmen are at the Stormcloaks' mercy now.
string: 没有落锤的银矿,要维持我们的军队开支会很麻烦......而另一方面,落锤人现在正任由风暴斗篷摆布.

original: My heart aches for the terror that the innocents will soon suffer at those barbarians' hands.
string: 一想到无辜者即将遭受那些野蛮人的蹂躏,我的心便隐隐作痛.

original: We've lost Hjaalmarch.
string: 我们失去了希雅陲领.

original: Hjaalmarch is just beneath Solitude. Having the rebels so close to our door... The thought itself is frightening!
string: 海芬加领就在独孤城下方.叛军离我们如此之近......光是想想就令人胆寒!

original: Here's hoping the marsh slows the rebels' advances long enough for us to retake it.
string: 但愿这片沼泽能拖慢叛军的推进速度,给我们足够时间夺回它.

original: We've taken the Rift.
string: 我们已经占领了裂隙.

original: And who did General Tullius install as the Rift's Jarl?
string: 那么图留斯将军任命谁担任裂谷城的领主呢?

original: Maven Black-Briar.
string: 玛雯.黑棘.

original: I've only met her a few times at soirees. She struck me as a capable woman, and the nobles around me all spoke highly of her.
string: 我只在几次晚宴上见过她.她给我的印象是位能干的女性,我周围的贵族也都对她赞誉有加.

original: Do you know her well?
string: 你和她很熟吗?

original: Maven Black-Briar is the most corrupt woman in Skyrim. But yes, she's capable.
string: 玛雯.黑棘是天际最腐败的女人.不过,她确实很有能力.

original: Ah, I see... I suppose the General had his reasons when picking our Jarl for the Rift.
string: 啊,我明白了......想必将军选择我们裂谷城的领主自有他的考量.

original: She will be a good Jarl.
string: 她会成为一位优秀的领主.

original: I hope so. Skyrim needs capable hands to restore order and peace once this war is over.
string: 希望如此.等这场战争结束,天际需要能干的人手来恢复秩序与和平.

original: I don't know her that well, I'm afraid.
string: 恐怕我和她不太熟.

original: Oh. I was hoping to hear more about my future vassals from different perspectives... But that's fine.
string: 哦.我本希望能从不同角度多听听我未来封臣的事......不过没关系.

original: We've taken the Pale.
string: 我们已经占领了苍原.

original: Dawnstar is one of Skyrim's three port cities. By securing it, Imperial ships can more freely pass into Skyrim. You've done well.
string: 晨星城是天际省三大港口城市之一.掌控此地后,帝国舰船便能更自由地出入天际.你做得很好.

original: We've taken Winterhold.
string: 我们已经占领了冬堡.

original: I've heard that Winterhold is nothing but ruins nowadays. When the war is finished, perhaps we can finally help it rebuild.
string: 我听说冬堡如今只剩一片废墟.等战争结束后,或许我们终于能帮助它重建了.

original: Can I ask you something personal?
string: 我能问你个私人问题吗?

original: Maybe when we're outside the town. Too many prying ears around here, you understand.
string: 也许等我们出了城再说吧.这里耳目太多,你懂的.

original: Sure. After all, I asked you to take me on this journey.
string: 当然.毕竟,是我请你带我踏上这段旅程的.

original: Maybe later. We've just talked about this awhile ago.
string: 也许晚点吧.我们不久前才刚聊过这个.

original: You mentioned you were not from Skyrim.
string: 你提到你不是来自天空省.

original: Not fully a Nord, either. I was originally from Bruma, over in Cyrodiil.
string: 也不算完全的诺德人.我原本来自布鲁玛,在赛洛迪尔那边.

original: My father was the Steward of Bruma's Count, you see. For years, he managed his liege's finances and helped lift his city from debts to prosperity.
string: 我父亲曾是布鲁玛伯爵的管家.多年来,他管理着领主的财务,帮助这座城市从负债累累走向繁荣昌盛.

original: When I was a child, I would sit with him to read the ledgers, learn the ropes of accounting and finance... And of course, the politics behind it all.
string: 小时候,我常和他一起翻阅账本,学习会计和财务的诀窍......当然,还有背后那些政治手腕.

original: You must be close to your father.
string: 你一定和父亲很亲近吧.

original: We were close. But after so many years in Skyrim, I fear I'm starting to forget it all. Our beautiful castle, the green hills... and his face.
string: 我们曾经很亲近.但在天际省这么多年后,我害怕自己开始遗忘这一切.我们美丽的城堡,翠绿的山丘......还有他的面容.

original: Is your father still the Steward of Bruma?
string: 你父亲还是布鲁玛的管家吗?

original: No. He was... He died many years ago.
string: 不.他......他很多年前就去世了.

original: I'm sorry. But I don't feel like talking about it yet.
string: 抱歉,但我还不想谈论这件事.

original: Why did you come to Skyrim?
string: 你为什么来天际?

original: To get familiar with my future home and family-in-law, what else.
string: 为了熟悉我未来的家和婆家人,还能有什么别的原因呢.

original: When I was just two moons old, my father had already betrothed me to the young prince Torygg. We would gain the prestige, and they the gold.
string: 在我刚满两个月大时,父亲就已将我许配给了年轻的王子托依格.我们将获得声望,而他们则得到黄金.

original: So your marriage with Torygg was arranged?
string: 所以你和托伊格的婚姻是安排好的?

original: Yeah. Such is the rule of my world... It's always about our families' legacy, and how much prestige, gold or armies each side can offer the other.
string: 是啊.这就是我所在世界的规则......永远围绕着家族的传承,以及各方能为彼此带来多少声望,黄金或军队.

original: In my case, our family was among the richest in Cyrodiil before the Vici came along.
string: 就我而言,在维齐家族崛起之前,我们家曾是赛洛迪尔最富有的家族之一.

original: Were you happy with it?
string: 你对它满意吗?

original: Would you believe me if I said I was indifferent about it?
string: 如果我说我对此毫不在意,你会相信吗?

original: All my life, I was told that I would one day cement the alliance between my family and Torygg's. So I lived by it without giving it much thought.
string: 从小到大,我一直被告知,终有一天我将巩固我的家族与托伊格的家族之间的联盟.因此我一直以此为目标生活,从未多加思索.

original: It was like... I just knew I must drink water and breathe, if that makes sense?
string: 这就像......我就是知道自己必须喝水,必须呼吸,你明白这种感觉吗?

original: Did you love Torygg?
string: 你爱托伊格吗?

original: You mean, despite the nature of our marriage?
string: 你是说,尽管我们的婚姻本质如此?

original: Yes. I found myself... caring about him eventually. Beneath his crown and cloak, I discovered a gentle and wise man.
string: 是的.我最终发现自己......在意他了.在他的王冠与斗篷之下,我发现了一个温柔而睿智的人.

original: He was my husband... and my friend. With his passing, there will always be a void in my heart that can never be filled.
string: 他曾是我的丈夫......也是我的朋友.他的离去,让我的心中永远留下了一个无法填补的空洞.

original: aaGoodbye
string: 再见

original: Let's face the world together.
string: 让我们携手面对这个世界.

original: Let's go, my love.
string: 我们走吧,亲爱的.

original: Sounds cruel. You were sold to Torygg's family without your consent.
string: 听起来很残忍.你未经同意就被卖给了托伊格家族.

original: Even if it were, I was too young to understand the concept of it; and by the time I came of age, I would've already married the prince.
string: 就算真是那样,我当时也太年轻,无法理解其中的含义;而等我成年时,早已嫁给了王子.

original: How did your parents die?
string: 你的父母是怎么去世的?

original: Their death is not a topic I am keen on visiting at this moment... I can, however, tell you something about my family.
string: 他们的死并非我此刻愿意谈及的话题......不过,关于我的家族,我倒可以告诉你一些事.

original: Sure thing. They were my most treasured.
string: 当然.它们曾是我最珍视的东西.

original: Can you tell me about your family again?
string: 能再和我聊聊你的家人吗?

original: No offense, but I don't feel like talking about this yet.
string: 无意冒犯,但我现在还不想谈论这件事.

original: Why did your father work for Bruma's Count if he was so wealthy?
string: 既然你父亲那么富有,为什么还要为布鲁玛的伯爵工作?

original: Because of his bond with Bruma's Count during the Great War, what else?
string: 因为他在大战期间与布鲁玛伯爵的盟约,还有什么?

original: After the War, Bruma fell into debt like most of Cyrodiil, and the Count had few who knew their way around coin, even fewer he could trust.
string: 战后,布鲁玛像西罗帝尔大部分地区一样陷入债务危机,伯爵手下懂理财的人寥寥无几,值得信赖的更是凤毛麟角.

original: So he sought my father's help to manage his finances - not for payment, but out of friendship. Can you imagine?
string: 所以他寻求我父亲的帮助来管理他的财务--不是为了报酬,而是出于友谊.你能想象吗?

original: Do you require a castle to be a noble?
string: 成为贵族必须拥有城堡吗?

original: Not always, but a castle symbolizes the might and dignity of a house. Without one, it is as if your family is bare and stripped.
string: 并非总是如此,但城堡象征着一个家族的权势与尊严.若没有城堡,你的家族就如同赤身裸体,一无所有.

original: More importantly, by having a piece of land in the realm, you have a tangible stake in its prosperity now.
string: 更重要的是,通过在王国拥有一片土地,你现在对其繁荣有了切实的利害关系.

original: In Skyrim, you are often required to purchase a property before being named Thane. It is a similar concept.
string: 在天际省,通常需要先购置房产才能获封为领主.这是一个类似的道理.

original: That sounds useful.
string: 听起来很有用.

original: You've already taught all I can learn at this moment.
string: 你此刻能教我的,我已尽数领悟.

original: I could unleash a fire against the Vici... but my people would burn before the flames could even lick their vineyards in Colovia.
string: 我本可对维希人施以烈火......但我的子民会在火焰触及科洛维亚的葡萄园前,便已葬身火海.

original: So, no. I will not trade my people's peace for vengeance, nor plunge Skyrim into war with the East Empire Company to soothe my own wounds.
string: 所以,不.我不会用我子民的安宁去换取复仇,也不会为了让自己的伤口愈合,就让天际与东帝国公司开战.

original: If peace demands my inheritance as its price, then it is my duty as Queen to make that sacrifice.
string: 若和平需要以我的继承权为代价,那么作为女王,献出这一切便是我的职责.

original: Solitude alone may stand no chance against the East Empire Company, but she has a queen who will pay any price to protect her people.
string: 孤城或许无力独自对抗东帝国公司,但她拥有一位愿为保护子民付出任何代价的女王.

original: You taught me how to fight with honor. Now I must learn to fight without it.
string: 你曾教会我如何光荣地战斗.如今我必须学会舍弃荣耀而战.

original: When the hour comes - Vittoria Vici will flee without her silks, and her kinsmen will find no place in Skyrim.
string: 当那一刻来临--维托莉亚.维琪将舍弃她的华服仓皇而逃,她的族人在天际省将再无容身之处.

original: After my parents' death, Torygg sent a loyal agent to Bruma to investigate.
string: 在我父母去世后,托伊格派了一名忠诚的密探前往布鲁玛进行调查.

original: The court had already burned their bodies to erase all evidence - yet somehow, he discovered traces of a rare poison in our estate.
string: 法庭早已焚毁他们的遗体以抹除所有证据--然而不知怎的,他竟在我们庄园里发现了罕见毒物的痕迹.

original: In time, he uncovered the full truth about their murder. It was by sheer luck that he made it back to Solitude alive.
string: 最终,他查明了他们被谋杀的完整真相.他能活着回到独孤城纯属侥幸.

original: When the letter from Bruma's new Count arrived, I could scarcely believe it - my father died fighting a thief, and my mother died of grief soon after.
string: 当布鲁玛新任伯爵的信函送达时,我几乎不敢相信--我的父亲在与盗贼搏斗中身亡,而我的母亲不久后也因悲痛离世.

original: But that was a story fabricated by their murderers. By those who had usurped all they had built and bastardized it all on their graves-
string: 但那不过是谋杀者编造的故事.那些篡夺了他们所建立的一切,并在他们坟茔之上将其彻底玷污之人--

original: House Vici, my own uncle, and Bruma's new Count.
string: 维齐家族,我的亲叔叔,以及布鲁玛的新任伯爵.

original: They are the wealthiest family in all of the Empire. While Cyrodiil bled gold after the Great War, the Vici alone grew fat on it.
string: 他们是整个帝国最富有的家族.在大战之后,赛洛迪尔的金库日渐枯竭,唯独维齐家族却因此愈发富足.

original: And until my parents' murder and the theft of their shares, the East Empire Company's power had stood in careful balance.
string: 而在我父母遇害,股份被盗之前,东帝国公司的权力一直保持着微妙的平衡.

original: Now, save for the Ruby Throne itself, I doubt there's anything in Cyrodiil they haven't already bought or stolen.
string: 如今,除了红宝石王座本身,我怀疑赛洛迪尔已经没有什么是他们尚未买下或偷走的东西了.

original: This is no jest. Swear it to me and the gods, and I will share this last secret of mine.
string: 这绝非戏言.向我与诸神立下誓言,我便将这最后的秘密与你分享.

original: Speaking of the inheritance my parents left me, I never really told you about their death. There... is a reason for that.
string: 说到我父母留给我的遗产,我其实从未真正告诉过你他们去世的经过.这其中......是有原因的.

original: I think... now is the time. In our travels, you've proven yourself someone I could trust with my very life.
string: 我想......时机已到.在旅途中,你已证明自己是值得我托付性命之人.

original: But you must swear to me - by every god you hold sacred - you will tell no one and take no action until you have my permission.
string: 但你必须向我发誓--以你信奉的每一位神明起誓--未经我的许可,你不得告诉任何人,也不得采取任何行动.

original: I've seen what you're capable of. It would be a waste if you were to be a courtier in the Blue Palace.
string: 我见识过你的能耐.若你留在蓝宫当个廷臣,那可就太屈才了.

original: Out here, under the gods' blue sky, you can do far more good... Just as I would in Solitude's court.
string: 在这片神明眷顾的蓝天下,你能行更多善事......正如我在独孤城的宫廷里所做的那样.

original: But perhaps it's too early to say. I still have much to see, much to learn, if I am to be a worthy queen.
string: 但或许现在说这些还为时过早.若要成为一位称职的女王,我仍有太多需要见识与学习.

original: I appreciate your honesty. It couldn't have been easy to speak so plainly to me on such matters.
string: 我很欣赏你的坦诚.在这样的问题上对我如此直言不讳,想必并不容易.

original: When my parents died, I was but a girl of ten, far away in Solitude's court. So naturally, my uncle stepped in and proclaimed himself my "guardian."
string: 当我父母去世时,我还只是个十岁的小女孩,远在独孤城的宫廷里.所以,我的叔叔自然就介入进来,宣布自己成为我的'监护人'.

original: When I looked beyond the window, I only saw the merchants doing their business, the bards playing their lute, and the guards patrolling the streets.
string: 当我望向窗外,只见到商贩们在经营生意,吟游诗人弹奏着鲁特琴,卫兵在街道上巡逻.

original: I am their Queen now, and I must be their anchor instead.
string: 如今我是他们的女王,我必须成为他们的支柱.

original: That's unfortunate. I wish for you to know the truth... but I won't force you to swear any vow against your heart. Let us go, then.
string: 这真令人遗憾.我本希望你能知晓真相......但我不会强迫你违背本心立下誓言.那么,我们走吧.

original: Thank you for seeing my point.
string: 感谢您能理解我的观点.

original: How did your parents meet? Were they an arranged pair too?
string: 你的父母是怎么认识的?他们也是包办婚姻吗?

original: Yeah. My mother was a lady from Falkreath, and my father a young lord from around Bruma. You could say they were practically neighbors.
string: 是的.我母亲是佛克瑞斯的一位淑女,父亲则是布鲁玛附近的一位年轻领主.可以说他们几乎是邻居.

original: In the aristocracy, we rarely have the luxury of marrying for love... But it's within our power to learn to love those we're married to.
string: 在贵族阶层,我们很少有幸能因爱结合......但学会去爱自己的婚姻伴侣,却是我们力所能及之事.

original: And I'm glad I found it with Torygg, just as my parents found it for each other.
string: 我很高兴能和托伊格一起找到它,就像我的父母为彼此找到的那样.

original: Did you inherit your family's castle?
string: 你继承了家族的城堡吗?

original: That, along with their share in the East Empire Company, their personal wealth, and anything else traceable on paper-
string: 那笔资产,连同他们在东帝国公司的股份,个人财富,以及任何其他有据可查的财产--

original: The only thing my uncle hasn't stolen was my memory for my parents... and if he could, I reckon he would take that too.
string: 我叔叔唯一没偷走的就是我对父母的记忆......要是他能,我估计他连这个也会夺走.

original: But you're an adult now. You can take back your inheritance.
string: 但你现在已经成年了,可以拿回你的遗产.

original: I may be my parents' daughter and heiress, but I am also Haafingar's Jarl and Skyrim's Queen, if she would have me.
string: 我或许是父母的女儿与继承人,但我也身兼海芬加领的领主,若她应允,我更是天际的女王.

original: Until my kingdom's peace is restored... Matters of my inheritance in Cyrodiil can wait.
string: 在我的王国恢复和平之前......我在赛洛迪尔的继承事宜可以暂缓.

original: Your uncle usurped your family's wealth? How?
string: 你叔叔篡夺了你家的财产?怎么回事?

original: Do you think he murdered your parents to steal their wealth?
string: 你认为他杀害你的父母是为了窃取他们的财富吗?

original: Like I said, I am not keen on visiting this topic right now.
string: 就像我说的,我现在不太想谈这个话题.

original: I thought Torygg would help you.
string: 我以为托伊格会帮你的.

original: He was but a child like I, barely having grown a strand of beard. His father, the High King back then, was the one to decide what to do with me.
string: 他那时和我一样,不过是个孩子,连胡须都还没长出一根.他的父亲,也就是当时的高王,决定了对我的处置.

original: And... he planned to send me back to Cyrodiil to secure my inheritance. Either I bring him the gold my parents promised, or don't bother returning.
string: 而且......他还打算把我送回赛洛迪尔,以确保我能继承家产.要么我带回父母承诺给他的金币,要么就别回去了.

original: But Torygg, with that strand of beard of his, stood up to his father and talked him into keeping me in Solitude, so that I'd be safe.
string: 但托伊格,就凭他那撮胡子,竟敢顶撞他父亲,说服他把我留在独孤城,好让我安全无虞.

original: What happened after your uncle stole your parents' wealth?
string: 你叔叔窃取你父母的财富之后发生了什么?

original: I stayed in Solitude's court for years, until I was finally old enough to marry Torygg.
string: 我在独孤城的宫廷里待了多年,直到终于到了可以嫁给托依格的年纪.

original: Akatosh will scorn me for this... But I was fortunate that my father-in-law had died a few years before that, and Torygg could make his own decision.
string: 阿卡托什会为此蔑视我......但幸运的是,我的岳父在那之前几年就去世了,托伊格可以自己做决定.

original: Then Torygg could finally help you retake your inheritance.
string: 那么托伊格就能帮你夺回你的继承权了.

original: Torygg tried his best... But those behind my uncle had influence even in Solitude.
string: 托伊格已经尽力了......但我叔叔背后的势力在独孤城也颇有影响.

original: Any misstep my husband made, then even his crown would not save him from those villains.
string: 我丈夫若有任何闪失,即便是他的王冠也无法从那些恶棍手中保全他.

original: Though I suppose such talks are useless now. He's gone... because of Ulfric and his blind zeal.
string: 不过我想现在说这些也没用了.他已经不在了......都是因为乌弗瑞克和他盲目的狂热.

original: What happened to your uncle?
string: 你叔叔怎么了?

original: He continued to spend my parents' gold quite lavishly. I can't even bear to think what he has done to their castle!
string: 他继续大手大脚地挥霍我父母的金币.我甚至不敢想象他对他们的城堡做了什么!

original: Most likely, he left it to ruin. And why not? He's in a far grander, more luxurious estate, courtesy of his wife.
string: 很可能,他任由它荒废了.这有什么好奇怪的呢?他现在住在一座更宏伟,更奢华的庄园里,这多亏了他的妻子.

original: His wife?
string: 他的妻子?

original: Lucilla Vici, one of Vittoria Vici's aunts. I assume you've had the "pleasure" of meeting that viper.
string: 露西拉.维齐,维多利亚.维齐的姨妈之一.我猜你已经"有幸"见过那条毒蛇了.

original: Viper? You mean Vittoria?
string: 毒蛇?你是指维托里亚?

original: How I enjoy being able to say what I mean. Beyond Solitude, beyond the Vici's grasp, in my trusted friend's presence... Out here, I am truly free.
string: 能畅所欲言的感觉真好.远离孤寂,挣脱维奇的掌控,在我信赖的朋友身边......在这里,我才真正自由.

original: Yes, that's who I meant. The venomous Vici family, who had allied themselves with my treacherous uncle.
string: 是的,我说的就是他们.那恶毒的维齐家族,他们与我那奸诈的叔父结成了同盟.

original: What do you have against the Vici?
string: 你对维齐人有什么不满?

original: For starters, how about they've practically seized control of Solitude's trade, bribed almost every noble in my court, and treated me like a puppet?
string: 首先,他们几乎掌控了独孤城的贸易,贿赂了我宫廷里几乎所有的贵族,还把我当傀儡一样对待,这怎么说?

original: How about the fact that they have, through my uncle, usurped my parents' shares in the East Empire Company, making them its de facto owners?
string: 他们通过我叔叔,侵吞了我父母在东帝国公司的股份,成为其实际所有者,这件事你怎么看?

original: And despite all that, I must put on my best smile every time they demand an audience, for it's fully in their power to make Haafingar starve!
string: 尽管如此,每当他们要求召见时,我都必须展露最得体的笑容,因为让海芬加陷入饥荒完全在他们的掌控之中!

original: But you're the Jarl. You can be mean to them if you want to.
string: 但您是领主啊,如果您愿意,完全可以对他们严厉些.

original: Heh. Easier said than done... I must think for my people before my own feelings.
string: 呵,说来容易做来难......我必须先为我的子民着想,而非个人情感.

original: I may not be the most experienced ruler... But I still know how to swallow my anger when it's time to parley.
string: 我或许不是经验最丰富的统治者......但我依然懂得在需要谈判时,如何咽下怒火.

original: I can help you take care of Vittoria Vici, if you want.
string: 如果你愿意,我可以帮你处理掉维托里亚.维齐.

original: I appreciate the offer, my friend. But what can I say?
string: 我很感激你的好意,朋友.但我该怎么说呢?

original: If you have to do it, do it when she's far, far away from Skyrim. Don't give them an excuse to start a crusade against us, hmm?
string: 如果你非做不可,那就趁她远离天际的时候动手.别给他们借口对我们发动圣战,嗯?

original: For the record, that was a jest.
string: 郑重声明,那只是个玩笑.

original: Like many noble houses, ours began as merchants. Over the decades, my ancestors amassed enough wealth to buy a castle, securing our noble status.
string: 与许多贵族世家一样,我们的家族最初也是商人.几十年来,我的祖先积累了足够的财富买下一座城堡,从而奠定了我们的贵族地位.

original: How was life after Torygg died?
string: 托伊格死后生活如何?

original: It has been a lonely life, if that makes sense.
string: 这是一种孤独的人生,你明白这种感觉吗?

original: Vittoria doesn't seem like a viper to me.
string: 在我看来,维托里亚并不像一条毒蛇.

original: Of course. Why would she bare her fangs to you, when you have nothing that interests her? That'd only tarnish her "elegant lady" outlook.
string: 当然.既然你身上没有她感兴趣的东西,她又何必对你龇牙咧嘴?那只会破坏她'优雅淑女'的形象.

original: Seems like they had much to gain from your parents' death.
string: 看来你父母的死让他们获益良多.

original: And I believe we should speak no further on this. For your own sake... and for mine.
string: 而且我认为我们不该再继续谈论此事了.为了你自己......也为了我.

original: My friend, you've proven to be a valuable soldier and a faithful subject; and most of all, someone I could trust.
string: 我的朋友,你已证明自己是一位可贵的战士,忠实的臣民,最重要的是,你是我可以信赖之人.

original: If you have time, I have another personal task for you. Please, seek me in private at night.
string: 如果你有时间,我还有一件私事想拜托你.请在夜晚私下找我.

original: Good, you remembered what I asked.
string: 很好,你记住了我的要求.

original: You were happy.
string: 你当时很开心.

original: I was, for two years. Those were the most beautiful times of my life... If I only knew how brief it would be, I'd cherish it even more.
string: 我曾是,整整两年.那是我生命中最美好的时光......如果早知道它如此短暂,我定会更加珍惜.

original: When Ulfric took him from me, I thought I had lost my last anchor in this world... that I had no one else to live for.
string: 当乌弗瑞克把他从我身边夺走时,我以为我在这个世界上失去了最后的依靠......以为我再也没有值得为之活下去的人了.

original: Surely you also have friends in Solitude.
string: 你在独孤城肯定也有朋友吧.

original: I have courtiers, Thanes, guards... perhaps an ally or two like Falk and Sybille. But real friends? I'm looking at all the friends I have.
string: 我有朝臣,领主,卫兵......或许还有一两个盟友,比如法尔克和西比尔.但真正的朋友?我眼前的就是我所有的朋友了.

original: You have my company now.
string: 你现在有我的陪伴了.

original: And out here, away from the court and its gossiping nobles... I know it's real.
string: 而在这里,远离宫廷和那些搬弄是非的贵族......我知道这一切都是真实的.

original: How about your family back home in Cyrodiil?
string: 你在赛洛迪尔的家人还好吗?

original: You mean my uncle? I'd hardly consider him my family after what he's done. Everyone back home that I once cared about was... gone.
string: 你是说我叔叔?在他做出那些事之后,我很难再把他当作家人.故乡所有我曾在意的人都......不在了.

original: I know how it is, losing your only anchor in this world.
string: 我明白那种感受,失去在这世上唯一的依靠.

original: Ulfric was a cruel man who cared for no one but his own ambition.
string: 乌弗瑞克是个冷酷无情的人,除了自己的野心,他谁都不在乎.

original: And you've avenged those who had fallen, Torygg included. For that, I owe you.
string: 你也为那些逝者报了仇,托伊格也在其中.为此,我欠你一份情.

original: You were weak to think that.
string: 你那么想就太软弱了.

original: What about your allies at court?
string: 你在宫廷里的盟友呢?

original: We have Falk, who treats me like his own daughter - and like many fathers, he thinks I'm the kind who never grows up.
string: 我们有法尔克,他待我如同亲生女儿--就像许多父亲一样,他觉得我是那种永远长不大的孩子.

original: Then there's Sybille, who was a godmother of sorts to Torygg... But I have the sense that she's merely tolerating me as Torygg's widow, not her Jarl.
string: 还有西比尔,她曾是托伊格的教母般的存在......但我感觉她只是容忍我作为托伊格的遗孀,而非她的领主.

original: There's also Bolgeir, who would take any assassin's blade for his Jarl - but he's hardly someone you'd talk to about your life or court politics.
string: 还有博盖尔,他愿意为他的领主挡下任何刺客的刀刃--但你几乎不可能和他谈论你的生活或宫廷政治.

original: As for Bryling - she thinks I haven't noticed, but I know she would've joined the Stormcloaks had her stubborn pride not held her back.
string: 至于白灵--她以为我没察觉,但我知道要不是她那固执的骄傲作祟,她早就加入风暴斗篷了.

original: And don't get me started on Erikur and his faction - the lot who have grown fat from Vici gold.
string: 更别提艾瑞库尔和他那一派了--那群靠维齐金币养肥的家伙.

original: Heh. It's good to vent about my court without fearing for anything.
string: 哈.能这样畅所欲言地吐槽我的法庭,不用担心任何后果,感觉真好.

original: Sounds like you have few you could truly depend on.
string: 听起来你似乎没有几个真正能依靠的人.

original: I had almost none... until you came along. Then I realize I don't have to fight this war alone.
string: 我原本几乎一无所有......直到你出现.那时我才意识到,我不必独自面对这场战争.

original: You are so ungrateful. The whole court is fighting to keep you as Jarl.
string: 你真是忘恩负义.整个宫廷都在竭力保住你的领主之位.

original: I'm not ungrateful. It's just that they all see me as... Never mind.
string: 我不是不知感恩.只是他们都把我看作......算了.

original: I could betray you and tell the court your true thoughts, you know.
string: 我完全可以背叛你,向法庭透露你的真实想法,你知道的.

original: You could, but I know you wouldn't.
string: 你本可以,但我知道你不会.

original: How are you so certain?
string: 你怎么这么肯定?

original: Because in all our journeys, you've risked your life to protect me from far worse things than Vici's venom. I know that I am... important to you.
string: 因为在所有旅途中,你都曾冒着生命危险保护我,让我免受比维琪的毒液更可怕的东西伤害.我知道我......对你很重要.

original: You'll always have my support, my queen.
string: 您永远拥有我的支持,我的女王.

original: Not quite Queen yet. But I know I can rely on you, with or without my crown.
string: 现在还不是女王.但我知道,无论是否头戴王冠,我都可以依靠你.

original: You'll be a great Queen for that thought alone.
string: 仅凭这份心意,您就会成为一位伟大的女王.

original: Countless warlords have chased greatness. I seek only to protect my people - but even that proves more intricate than it seems.
string: 无数军阀追逐过丰功伟业.我只愿守护我的子民--但即便这个目标,也比表面看来更为复杂.

original: That's why I'm out here, learning the ways of our world at your side.
string: 这就是我在此的原因,在你身边学习我们世界的法则.

original: Because you... have started to become my anchor.
string: 因为你......已开始成为我的锚点.

original: Because when I'm with you, I remember how it's like to have a real friend.
string: 因为和你在一起时,我记起了拥有真正朋友的感觉.

original: He robbed from an orphan.
string: 他抢了一个孤儿的东西.

original: I've yet to see him guard me, but he was certainly quick to take charge of my parents' estate.
string: 我还没见过他保护我,但他接手我父母遗产倒是快得很.

original: The man saw an opportunity and acted.
string: 那人见机行事.

original: I see why you cared about him.
string: 我明白你为什么在乎他了.

original: He would defy his own father and King to protect me, not only as my betrothed... but because he wanted to do the right thing.
string: 他违抗自己的父亲和国王也要保护我,不仅因为他是我的未婚夫......更因为他想做正确的事.

original: Safe from what?
string: 安全是指什么?

original: I... I'm sorry, but maybe I shouldn't say more. You are a good friend - but even between friends, there are things that are best remain untold.
string: 我......抱歉,或许我不该再多说了.你是个好朋友--但即便是朋友之间,有些事也最好保持沉默.

original: No viper could get through me.
string: 没有毒蛇能从我这里通过.

original: They couldn't even if they tried, my valiant shield.
string: 他们就算尝试也做不到,我英勇的护盾.

original: Were you happy after you married Torygg?
string: 嫁给托伊格后,你过得幸福吗?

original: The maidens thought our marriage to be one of fairy tales, and indeed it was, to some degree.
string: 少女们以为我们的婚姻如同童话一般,在某种程度上,确实如此.

original: When he was still with me, I stayed as far away from the court as can be, so that I never had to meet the faces of Vici, Erikur and Sybille.
string: 当他还和我在一起时,我尽可能远离宫廷,这样我就永远不必面对维齐,埃里克和西比尔的面孔.

original: Instead, I would go hear the birds sing, pick up a book and wait in our garden, for Torygg to join me and share the day's events at court.
string: 相反,我会去聆听鸟儿的歌唱,拿起一本书,在我们的花园里等待托伊格来与我相聚,分享宫廷里一天发生的事.

original: If you ignored his crown, then we were... just like any couple, you know.
string: 如果你忽略了他的王冠,那么我们......就像任何一对普通情侣一样,你知道的.

original: Aren't you afraid there will be gossips about us?
string: 你不怕别人会说我们的闲话吗?

original: Let the servants have their fun. There will never be any evidence, because nothing of the sort is happening between us.
string: 就让仆人们去嚼舌根吧.永远不会有任何证据,因为我们之间根本不存在那种事.

original: I answer your summon.
string: 我响应你的召唤.

original: And I appreciate it. It seems few in our court still remember they have a Jarl these days, much less a Queen.
string: 我很感激.如今我们宫廷里似乎没几个人还记得他们还有个领主,更别说女王了.

original: Which is why I've summoned you in private. You've proven to be someone I could trust... perhaps even with my own life.
string: 正因如此,我才私下召见你.你已证明自己是值得信赖之人......或许甚至值得我托付性命.

original: But first, I beg an answer to this question - how would you judge my reign, if you were a bard or a historian a century from now?
string: 但首先,我恳请你回答这个问题--倘若你是一百年后的吟游诗人或史学家,你会如何评价我的统治?

original: Well, I am indeed a bard of sorts.
string: 嗯,我确实算是个吟游诗人.

original: Ah, yes. Well, then how would you write about my reign, Master Minstrel?
string: 啊,确实.那么,吟游诗人大师,你会如何书写我的统治呢?

original: You would be the Idle Queen, who delegated everything to your servants.
string: 你将成为闲散女王,将一切事务都交由仆从打理.

original: You would be the Puppet Queen, who was manipulated by scheming politicians.
string: 你将成为傀儡女王,被诡计多端的政客所操控.

original: You would be the Wailing Queen, who spent your days mourning instead of ruling.
string: 你将成为哀恸女王,终日沉溺于哀悼而非治国.

original: You would be the Unready, because you were young and inexperienced.
string: 你将成为'未备者',因为你年轻且缺乏经验.

original: I suppose Solitude couldn't ask for a better queen.
string: 我想,独孤城再也找不到比我更合适的女王了.

original: No, I suppose not. Because I am all they've got.
string: 不,我想不会.因为他们只有我了.

original: I don't think it's my place to judge it.
string: 我认为我没有资格评判这件事.

original: I give you my promise as Jarl and your future Queen, there will be no repercussion for you.
string: 我以领主及你未来女王的名义向你保证,你不会受到任何牵连.

original: I haven't been in Solitude long enough to make a judgment on that.
string: 我在独孤城待的时间还不够长,无法对此做出判断.

original: That's a fair answer, I suppose.
string: 我想这算是个公正的回答.

original: I may have inherited my husband's throne, but I may as well be a prisoner in my own palace.
string: 我虽继承了丈夫的王位,却如同困在宫中的囚徒.

original: Falk respects me, but ultimately still sees me as the child who had just married Torygg. The rest of the court barely sees me as their Jarl.
string: 法尔克尊重我,但终究还是把我看作那个刚嫁给托依格的孩子.宫廷里的其他人几乎不把我当作他们的领主.

original: I am sure the court respects you. You are overthinking.
string: 我相信朝廷是敬重您的,您多虑了.

original: Do they, now? Yet, it seems they take their orders from General Tullius and Vittoria Vici, only informing me after the fact.
string: 是吗?可他们似乎只听图留斯将军和维托莉亚.维琪的号令,事后才通知我一声.

original: You are still young and inexperienced. It is natural.
string: 你还年轻且缺乏经验,这很自然.

original: Torygg was young and inexperienced too, yet the court looked up to him.
string: 托伊格虽然年轻且缺乏经验,但宫廷上下都敬重他.

original: You would be the Fair Queen, known for your beauty.
string: 你将成为以美貌闻名的仙后.

original: That was flattering, but I was asking about my reign, not my face.
string: 这很受用,但我问的是我的统治,而非我的容貌.

original: What do you plan to do about it?
string: 你打算怎么处理这件事?

original: I know my limits well, friend. I am no schemer like Erikur, no warrior like Torygg... Gods, I'm not even from Skyrim!
string: 我很清楚自己的极限,朋友.我不像艾瑞库尔那样善于谋划,也不像托依格那样骁勇善战......诸神在上,我甚至都不是天际省的人!

original: And given time, I will indeed become the weeping, powerless puppet the likes of Erikur and Vici intend me to be.
string: 假以时日,我确实会变成埃里克和维齐之流所期望的那种哭泣无助的傀儡.

original: But not while I still have the fight in me. I may not be the queen that Skyrim asked for, but I must become the queen that she needs.
string: 但在我心中战意未泯之时,绝不会如此.我或许不是天际所期盼的女王,但我必须成为她所需要的那位君主.

original: That's why I ask this of you - let me travel at your side, so that I can see my subjects with my own eyes, learn the ways of our world-
string: 正因如此我才向你提出这个请求--让我与你同行,让我亲眼看看我的子民,了解这个世界的运行之道--

original: And then, I will grow into the Queen my kingdom deserves.
string: 然后,我将成长为我的王国所应得的女王.

original: You're putting a lot of faith in me.
string: 你对我寄予了很大的信任.

original: Believe it or not... You're one of the last few I could rely on. If you betray me, then I will truly be lost - as will Solitude.
string: 信不信由你......你是我最后几个能依靠的人之一了.如果你背叛我,那我就真的完了--独孤城也一样.

original: I can see why the Stormcloaks hated you so much.
string: 我明白风暴斗篷为什么那么恨你了.

original: They didn't call me the "Foreigner's Queen" for nothing. But whatever they say, Skyrim is my home now, and she will always be.
string: 他们叫我"异乡人的女王"可不是白叫的.但不管他们怎么说,天际现在是我的家,而且永远都是.

original: Does the court approve?
string: 宫廷方面同意吗?

original: Why should they? It's not like they ever required my approval.
string: 他们凭什么要?他们又没征求过我的同意.

original: Can Solitude function without its Jarl?
string: 独孤城没有领主还能正常运转吗?

original: Oh, Falk will manage it fine. Besides... it will be no different to the nobles, whether it's me or an idle illusion sitting on the throne.
string: 哦,福尔克会处理好的.况且......对贵族们来说,是我还是一个无所事事的幻影坐在王座上,都没什么区别.

original: I go to dangerous places. Can you fight?
string: 我去危险的地方.你会打架吗?

original: I'll tell you the truth - I cannot. Not as valiantly as you, anyway. That's why I must rely on you to defend your future queen when it comes to that.
string: 实话告诉你--我做不到.至少无法像你那样英勇无畏.正因如此,当那一刻来临时,我必须仰仗你来守护你未来的女王.

original: If you could teach me how to defend myself, that'd also be appreciated.
string: 如果你能教我如何自卫,我也会很感激的.

original: So how does this work, exactly? Am I just to bring the future High Queen around?
string: 那么具体该怎么做?我只需要把未来的至高女王带过来就行了吗?

original: Sybille gifted me a magical amulet. It will conjure an illusion of myself, and everyone else will see me as a simple adventurer visiting the palace.
string: 西比尔送了我一枚魔法护身符.它会召唤出我自己的幻象,而其他人则会把我视为一位前来宫殿参观的普通冒险者.

original: It will be my honor to protect you, Jarl Elisif.
string: 保护您是我的荣幸,艾莉西弗领主.

original: Thank you. Now, let me just wear the amulet...
string: 谢谢.现在,让我戴上这条护身符......

original: If there's a reward.
string: 如果有报酬的话.

original: Rest assured, I still command a part of the treasury. Now, let me just wear the amulet...
string: 放心,我仍掌管着部分国库.现在,让我戴上这条护身符......

original: Sorry, I can't guarantee your safety. You need to find someone else.
string: 抱歉,我无法保证你的安全.你需要另寻他人.

original: Here's something to reward your loyalty, and for the troubles ahead. I am ready to begin this journey whenever you are, Champion.
string: 这是对你忠诚的奖赏,也是为前路的艰险准备的.我已准备好踏上这段旅程,随时可以开始,冠军.

original: You should resume your duty as Jarl.
string: 你应当恢复领主的职责.

original: Of course! Let me just wear this amulet...
string: 当然!让我戴上这条护身符......

original: Would you like to travel with me?
string: 你愿意和我一起旅行吗?

original: Don't worry. You'll have my help with that.
string: 别担心,我会帮你处理这件事的.

original: I know I will, my dear friend.
string: 我知道我会的,我亲爱的朋友.

original: You never expected to become the ruling Jarl.
string: 你从未想过会成为统治一方的领主.

original: Can any young woman ever expect their husband's death?
string: 有哪个年轻女子会期盼丈夫死去呢?

original: I never aspired to rule. That was my husband's job - to keep us both and Skyrim safe. From the Thalmor, the dissidents, and House Vici.
string: 我从未渴望统治.那是我丈夫的职责--保护我们两人和天际的安全,远离梭莫,异见者以及维齐家族.

original: But it's my burden now. I owe it to him - and my people - to restore this kingdom's peace.
string: 但如今这已是我的责任.为了他,也为了我的子民,我必须恢复这个王国的和平.

original: I am no Torygg, but I want you to know I'll always be at your side. (Romantic)
string: 我虽不是托伊格,但我想让你知道,我会永远在你身边.(浪漫)

original: But sooner or later, our anchors beckon us both. Mine is Solitude's throne, for that's where I can help my people.
string: 但迟早,我们的锚点都会召唤我们.我的是孤独城的王座,因为在那里我能帮助我的人民.

original: Yours is in the wide open world, and I cannot simply pull you away like that.
string: 你的世界广阔无垠,我不能就这样将你拉离.

original: I will stay in your service when that time comes.
string: 届时我愿继续为您效劳.

original: You are more important to me.
string: 你对我来说更重要.

original: I can still serve you while away from court.
string: 即使不在宫廷,我依然可以为您效劳.

original: Hmm, that doesn't sound like a bad idea. When General Tullius inevitably retires, perhaps I can write to the Emperor to recommend a new General.
string: 嗯,这主意听起来不错.等图留斯将军退休后,或许我可以写信给皇帝,推荐一位新将军.

original: Perhaps you're right. I'm bound for adventures. (Block romance)
string: 也许你是对的.我注定要去冒险.(阻止浪漫)

original: I know you are. Out here, under the gods' blue sky, you can do far more good... Just as I would in Solitude's court.
string: 我知道你是.在这片神明庇佑的蓝天下,你能行更多善举......正如我在孤独城的宫廷中也会如此.

original: Best of luck.
string: 祝你好运.

original: Do you think you are ready to be the High Queen?
string: 你认为自己准备好成为至高女王了吗?

original: If you asked me a few months ago, I reckon my answer would've been "No, but I have to be."
string: 如果几个月前你问我,我估计我的回答会是"不,但我必须这样.

original: But now, after seeing so much out here with you, outsmarting foes like bandits, vampires and Daedra... and still coming out alive?
string: 但现在,与你一同在外经历了这么多,智胜了强盗,吸血鬼和魔族这样的敌人......还能活着回来?

original: I think I'm as ready as can be. But of course, I'm in no rush to return to Solitude's throne, if that's what you're asking.
string: 我认为自己已经准备得足够充分了.不过,如果你是想问这个的话,我当然不急于回到独孤城的王座上.

original: You've grown so much as an adventurer and a leader. I'm proud of you.
string: 作为一名冒险者和领导者,你已经成长了太多.我为你感到骄傲.

original: Be proud of yourself instead. Without a good mentor and protector, I wouldn't even have made it out of Haafingar.
string: 你该为自己感到骄傲.如果没有一位好导师和守护者,我甚至都无法活着离开海芬加领.

original: You are always welcome to be my companion.
string: 随时欢迎你成为我的同伴.

original: And your voice will always be heard in the Blue Palace.
string: 你的声音将永远在蓝宫中回响.

original: Let us pray you won't be a dreadful queen.
string: 愿你不会成为一位可怕的王后.

original: Whatever failures come my way, I'll blame them squarely on my diligent mentor.
string: 无论我遭遇何种失败,我都会直接归咎于我那位勤勉的导师.

original: You are now strong enough to fight for your family's estate.
string: 你现在已经有足够的力量去争取家族的产业了.

original: You will be the High Queen. Reclaiming your inheritance shouldn't be an issue.
string: 你将成为至高女王.夺回你的继承权应该不成问题.

original: Sounds serious. Why?
string: 听起来很严重.为什么?

original: I knew something was up about their death.
string: 我就知道他们的死有蹊跷.

original: Sorry, it sounds like more than I could handle. I choose not to hear it.
string: 抱歉,这听起来超出了我的承受范围.我选择不听.

original: I cannot swear that vow.
string: 我不能立下那个誓言.

original: I swear.
string: 我发誓.

original: Thank you... And now, my last, deepest secret, that I've only ever shared with Torygg. My parents' murder.
string: 谢谢你......现在,我要说出最后一个,也是埋藏最深的秘密,这个秘密我只曾与托依格分享过.那就是我父母遇害的真相.

original: Why hide it until now?
string: 为何要隐瞒至今?

original: Because unlike the harmless lady that Vittoria Vici masquerades herself as, her family has influence everywhere in Cyrodiil, Haafingar and beyond.
string: 因为与维托利亚.维齐伪装成的那位无害女士不同,她的家族在赛洛迪尔,哈芬加尔乃至更远的地方都拥有广泛的影响力.

original: Do you even know how many allies they have in my city? How many families they would gladly break just for a few more coin in their coffer?
string: 你可知他们在我的城市里有多少盟友?为了往钱袋里多添几枚金币,他们不惜拆散多少家庭?

original: I'm sorry that I couldn't tell you earlier. But had Vittoria Vici caught wind of what I knew... I dare not imagine what would have followed.
string: 很抱歉我没能早点告诉你.但如果维多利亚.维齐察觉到我知晓此事......我不敢想象接下来会发生什么.

original: But now, I am sure I can trust you without reserve. You deserve to know the burden I truly bear... and the adversary that I face.
string: 但现在,我确信可以毫无保留地信任你.你理应知晓我真正背负的重担......以及我所面对的敌手.

original: What made you so certain?
string: 是什么让你如此确信?

original: Tell me more about the Vici.
string: 能再和我多说说维齐的事吗?

original: How do you plan to defeat them?
string: 你打算如何击败他们?

original: The truth is... I know I can never get my parents' inheritance back. Not from the Vici.
string: 真相是......我知道我永远拿不回父母的遗产了.从维齐家族那里是不可能的.

original: But if it's any solace, at least I've gotten my husband's kingdom back. Now, I've grown strong enough to protect my people from that house of vipers.
string: 但如果能稍感安慰的话,至少我已夺回了丈夫的王国.如今,我已足够强大,能够保护我的人民免受那毒蛇之家的侵害.

original: I will kill Vittoria Vici for you.
string: 我会为你杀了维托里亚.维齐.

original: No! This is why I made you swear that vow.
string: 不!这就是我让你立下誓言的原因.

original: I will not have you become their target, nor will I give them an excuse to bring another bloodbath to my land.
string: 我不会让你成为他们的目标,也不会给他们任何借口,在我的土地上再掀起一场腥风血雨.

original: So you're going to leave your parents unavenged.
string: 所以你打算让你父母的仇就这么算了.

original: Would you have me make the attempt, die trying - and condemn all of Solitude to follow?
string: 你是要让我去尝试,哪怕牺牲性命--然后让整个独孤城都跟着陪葬吗?

original: That's the right call. A war with them would destroy many innocents' livelihood.
string: 这是明智的决定.与他们开战会毁掉许多无辜者的生计.

original: I'm the Dragonborn. The Vici are mortal. I'll march to Cyrodiil and defeat them.
string: 我是龙裔.维齐家族不过是凡人.我将进军西罗帝尔,击败他们.

original: One war barely ended, and you'd already unleash another upon us?
string: 一场战争才刚结束,你就想对我们再发动一场?

original: The Vici are a cancer. If they remain, then the Empire can never heal.
string: 维齐家族是帝国的毒瘤.只要他们还在,帝国就永远无法痊愈.

original: You're right. If I've learned anything from our adventures, it's that evil flourishes while our sword-arms are idle.
string: 你说得对.如果我从我们的冒险中学到了什么,那就是当我们放下手中的剑时,邪恶便会滋长.

original: The Vici didn't just steal - they murdered. Can you be sure they'll spare you?
string: 维齐家族不仅偷窃--他们还杀人.你能确定他们会放过你吗?

original: Your counsel is wise. Even if I stay my hand from vengeance, my claim to the inheritance alone will haunt their sleep.
string: 您的建议很明智.即便我暂缓复仇,仅凭我对遗产的继承权,就足以让他们夜不能寐.

original: Tell me about your parents' murder again.
string: 能再和我讲讲你父母遇害的事吗?

original: Tell me about the Vici.
string: 能和我讲讲维齐家族的事吗?

original: What made you so certain the Vici killed your parents?
string: 是什么让你如此确信是维齐人杀害了你的父母?

original: How do you plan to deal with the Vici?
string: 你打算如何应对维齐人?

original: Agreed. With their resources and allies, you'd just be fighting a vain war.
string: 同意.以他们的资源和盟友,你只会打一场徒劳的战争.

original: Let's talk about combat tactics.
string: 我们来聊聊战斗策略吧.

original: You need better skills to survive out here. (Training)
string: 你需要更好的本事才能在这儿活下去.(训练)

original: So soon? I can barely absorb anything at this rate! Why don't we have another session sometime later?
string: 这么快?我根本消化不了!不如我们改天再约一次?

original: Let's do some combat training. (Training)
string: 我们来做个战斗训练吧.

original: I may not be a fighter like you, but I'm ready to learn. What kind of skills?
string: 我可能不像你那样是战士,但我已准备好学习.是什么样的技能?

original: I'm always eager to be better. What kind of skills?
string: 我一直渴望变得更强.是什么样的技能?

original: I can show you a few skills to improve your chances. (Training)
string: 我可以教你几招,提高你的胜算.(训练)

original: Those will come in handy. Please, show me.
string: 那些会派上用场的.请给我看看.

original: There are a few tricks that might help you in battle. (Training)
string: 有几招或许能在战斗中帮到你.(训练)

original: I'll be able to train you when I get better in combat. (Training)
string: 等我战斗技巧更娴熟些,就能指导你训练了.

original: I'll teach you something about archery.
string: 我来教你一些关于射箭的知识.

original: Just need to steady my hands...
string: 只需要稳住我的手......

original: I just need to focus on the mark...
string: 我只需要专注于目标......

original: I quite enjoy the sound of arrow now.
string: 我现在还挺喜欢箭矢的声音.

original: I'll teach you something about light-weight weapons.
string: 我来教你一些关于轻型武器的知识.

original: I better not cut myself with that...
string: 我最好别被那玩意儿割伤......

original: I think I'm getting the hang of this...
string: 我觉得我慢慢掌握诀窍了......

original: More sparring, huh?
string: 还想再切磋切磋吗?

original: I'll teach you how to wear heavy armor better.
string: 我来教你如何更好地穿戴重甲.

original: Are you sure? I feel like I can barely move in that armor!
string: 你确定吗?我觉得穿着那身盔甲我几乎动弹不得!

original: I feel slow while moving in this, but I think I'll manage.
string: 穿着这个移动感觉有点慢,不过我想我能应付.

original: It doesn't feel that heavy now. Whatever you taught, it's working.
string: 现在感觉没那么重了.你教的东西,确实管用.

original: Like wearing a fine silk dress into the battlefield.
string: 如同身着华美丝绸长裙步入战场.

original: I'll teach you how to wear light armor better.
string: 我来教你如何更好地穿戴轻甲.

original: It doesn't seem that defensive to me... But I trust you.
string: 在我看来这似乎并不那么防御性......但我相信你.

original: I'm feeling quite agile in this armor.
string: 穿上这身盔甲,我感觉身手矫健多了.

original: I'll be as swift as the wind in battle.
string: 我会在战场上迅捷如风.

original: I'll teach you how to block with your weapon or shield.
string: 我来教你如何用武器或盾牌格挡.

original: I'll teach you how to scorch, freeze or shock your enemies.
string: 我来教你如何灼烧,冻结或电击你的敌人.

original: That reminds me of Sybille.
string: 这让我想起了西比尔.

original: It always leaves such a mess. Good thing we don't need to do the cleaning.
string: 它总是弄得一团糟.幸好我们不用负责打扫.

original: All the creative ways to turn the tides, yes?
string: 所有扭转局势的巧妙方法,对吧?

original: I'll teach you how to heal better.
string: 我来教你如何更好地治疗.

original: I'll do my best to help when it comes to that.
string: 在这方面我会尽力帮忙的.

original: With this art, I'll keep us both safe.
string: 凭借这门技艺,我会护你我周全.

original: I'll never let you down whenever you need healing.
string: 无论何时你需要治疗,我都绝不会让你失望.

original: Never mind.
string: 算了.

original: I'll teach you how to wield heavy weapons.
string: 我来教你如何挥舞重型武器.

original: With that slab of metal, I'll collapse after one swing if I even hit anything! No offense, but let's be honest, it hardly fits a... Well, a lady.
string: 拿着那块铁疙瘩,就算打中东西,挥一下我也得散架!无意冒犯,但说实话,这玩意儿实在不太适合......嗯,一位淑女.

original: I'd fare better with lighter weapons - or magic, if you could teach me.
string: 轻武器我用得更顺手--或者魔法也行,如果你愿意教我的话.

original: I'll teach you how to use Alteration magic to create magic armors.
string: 我来教你如何运用变化系魔法来创造魔法护甲.

original: I need you to perform a different role in combat.
string: 我需要你在战斗中担任不同的角色.

original: Use destruction magic against our enemies.
string: 用毁灭系魔法对付敌人.

original: I need you to fight in the frontline.
string: 我需要你在前线作战.

original: Be a sellsword and use a mix of magic and melee combat.
string: 成为一名佣兵,结合魔法与近战进行战斗.

original: Use bow and arrows.
string: 使用弓箭.

original: In addition to combat, I would like you to heal me when I'm down.
string: 除了战斗之外,我希望在我倒下时你能治疗我.

original: No need to heal me, focus on fighting.
string: 不需要治疗我,专注于战斗.

original: Let's talk about something else.
string: 我们聊点别的吧.

original: What will I be to you?
string: 我对你来说会是什么?

original: There are many ways to call you - "mentor", "guardian", "champion" - to name a few-
string: 人们可以用许多方式来称呼你--"导师","守护者","冠军"--仅举几例-

original: I prefer the term "companion."
string: 我更喜欢"同伴"这个称呼.

original: I'm sorry, but you're walking down a path I can't follow. I cannot call you my mentor and still live with my conscience.
string: 很抱歉,你正走在一条我无法追随的道路上.我无法既称你为导师,又心安理得地活下去.

original: For your service, I won't have the guards arrest you... But you take care of yourself now. May the gods help you find salvation.
string: 看在你帮忙的份上,我就不让卫兵逮捕你了......但你好自为之吧.愿众神助你寻得救赎.

original: Vittoria Vici is dead.
string: 维托里亚.维齐死了.

original: I know. I saw that in her wedding.
string: 我知道.我在她的婚礼上看到了.

original: Did you think her death changes anything? The Vici still loom in the south, waiting to buy off everything in Skyrim as they did in Cyrodiil.
string: 你以为她的死能改变什么吗?维齐家族依然盘踞在南方,等着像在赛洛迪尔那样买下天际的一切.

original: If anything, you've only given them an excuse for blood. Now, I can only pray that Skyrim is prepared for their wrath.
string: 如果说有什么不同,你只是给了他们一个嗜血的借口.现在,我只能祈祷天际省已准备好承受他们的怒火.

original: About how brave you should be in combat...
string: 关于你在战斗中应当展现的勇气......

original: Try to help if you can, but value your safety first.
string: 力所能及就帮一把,但务必以自身安全为先.

original: Run and save yourself when there are fights.
string: 遇到打斗就快跑,保住自己的命要紧.

original: Be brave, try not to escape the fights.
string: 要勇敢,尽量不要逃避战斗.

original: Attack our enemies on sight. I'll cover you.
string: 一见到敌人就攻击,我来掩护你.

original: Don't engage the enemies. Stay behind me.
string: 不要与敌人交战.跟在我身后.

original: Explain to me why my royal guardian is in league with a pack of scoundrels in a sewer.
string: 向我解释一下,为何我的皇家护卫会与一帮下水道里的恶棍勾结在一起.

original: It's a lucrative business. You'll see.
string: 这是一门利润丰厚的生意,你会明白的.

original: What paltry trinkets could these gutter thieves provide that your queen's favor cannot bestow tenfold? You spat on my law, and you insulted my faith.
string: 这些阴沟里的窃贼能拿出什么寒酸小玩意儿,是你女王的恩宠所不能十倍赐予的?你践踏了我的律法,更亵渎了我的信仰.

original: It's important for a future queen to learn to deal with the underworld.
string: 对未来的女王而言,学会与地下世界打交道至关重要.

original: Torygg didn't require thugs and criminals to secure his throne. All he needed was his people's respect and love.
string: 托伊格无需依靠暴徒与罪犯来稳固王位,他需要的只是人民的敬爱与拥戴.

original: Love and respect can't endure a vile rumor spread by your enemies.
string: 爱与尊重敌不过敌人散布的卑劣谣言.

original: I see. Before Torygg died... There were talks of his "incompetence" both at court and in town. I've always wondered what began those foul slander.
string: 我明白了.在托伊格去世之前......宫廷和市井间都流传着关于他"无能"的议论.我一直很好奇,这些恶毒的诽谤究竟从何而起.

original: If such rumors were quelled, perhaps Ulfric wouldn't have found allies in my city. Then, at least... he would've been brought to justice right then.
string: 如果这类谣言能被平息,也许乌弗瑞克就不会在我的城市里找到盟友了.那样的话,至少......他当时就能被绳之以法.

original: Many seek to dethrone you. The Guild could protect you in the shadows.
string: 许多人图谋推翻你.公会可在暗处护你周全.

original: And so I must stoop to the level of Erikur and Vici, yes? Become honorless, ruthless, just to secure my crown?
string: 所以我必须自降身份,与埃瑞库尔和维齐之流为伍,是吗?为了确保我的王位,就得变得毫无荣誉,冷酷无情?

original: You must learn to fight dirty to protect yourself sometimes.
string: 有时你必须学会不择手段地战斗来保护自己.

original: I... I understand. If that's what it takes to survive, then I'll learn what I must.
string: 我......我明白了.如果这是生存所必需的,那么我会去学习我必须掌握的东西.

original: A dead queen cannot protect her people.
string: 死去的女王无法保护她的人民.

original: So, Erikur is dealing with this "Balmora Blue" and expects you to frame a captain with it.
string: 那么,埃瑞库尔正在处理这瓶"巴尔莫拉蓝",并指望你用它来陷害一位船长.

original: All these months I've ruled Solitude, and never did I realize such foul hands were sullying my halls!
string: 我统治独孤城这么多个月,竟从未察觉有如此肮脏之手玷污我的殿堂!

original: I can ignore Erikur if you want.
string: 如果你愿意,我可以无视埃瑞库尔.

original: What's the point? He'll just have another man be dispatched, or even find someone worse himself. Your Guild would lose his trust for nothing.
string: 这有什么意义?他只会再派另一个人来,甚至亲自找个更糟的.你的公会将白白失去他的信任.

original: I can inform the guards about Erikur's plot.
string: 我可以向守卫报告艾瑞库尔的阴谋.

original: Erikur has eyes among the guards. By the time they breach his manor, he'll have woven some lies or fled like a craven.
string: 埃瑞库尔在守卫中有眼线.等他们攻破他的庄园时,他要么编造一些谎言,要么像个懦夫一样逃之夭夭.

original: I think we should carry forward with this mission.
string: 我认为我们应该继续执行这个任务.

original: And frame an innocent man just to satisfy Erikur's envy and greed? Why?
string: 就为了满足埃瑞库尔的嫉妒和贪婪,去陷害一个无辜的人?为什么?

original: What do you think we should do?
string: 你觉得我们该怎么做?

original: I would've loved for you to get that Balmora Blue, toss it into the sea, then wash your hands of it-
string: 我本希望你能拿到那瓶巴尔莫拉蓝,把它扔进海里,然后就此洗手不干--

original: But then, you'll lose your guild's faith. All the crimes we've done would have been for nothing.
string: 但那样的话,你会失去公会的信任.我们犯下的所有罪行都将变得毫无意义.

original: Perhaps there's no other choice. I'll have the guards provide the captain soft beds and warm meals - small mercy for what must come.
string: 或许别无选择了.我会让守卫为船长提供柔软的床铺和热腾腾的饭菜--对于即将到来的事,这已是微薄的仁慈.

original: We'll gain dirt on Erikur and get a hook on him.
string: 我们将搜集艾瑞库尔的把柄,并掌握他的软肋.

original: So we return to these unsavory methods. I suppose there's no avoiding it if I am to be Queen.
string: 看来我们终究还是得用这些不光彩的手段.若想成为女王,恐怕是避不开了.

original: That's a good point. Erikur thought he could manipulate me at court, but this time, I'll outmatch him in his game.
string: 说得好.埃瑞库尔以为能在宫廷里操纵我,但这次我会在他的游戏中胜出.

original: We need to keep Erikur happy, so that he keeps trusting us.
string: 我们需要让艾瑞库尔高兴,这样他才会继续信任我们.

original: And one captain's dignity is all the price you have to pay, right? What else to gain a corrupt Thane's trust?
string: 而一位队长的尊严就是你所需付出的全部代价,对吧?还有什么能比这更能赢得一位腐败的领主信任呢?

original: An interesting point. I admit, I haven't thought we could create an alliance with him in such a way.
string: 有意思的观点.我承认,我没想到能以这种方式与他结盟.

original: Granted, his loyalty is to himself first, the Vici second, and Solitude third - but where I have use for him, I can work through your guild.
string: 诚然,他首先忠于自己,其次是维齐家族,独孤城排第三--但在我需要他的地方,我可以通过你的公会来运作.

original: So be it. Let us complete this task for Erikur.
string: 那就这样吧.让我们为埃瑞库尔完成这项任务.

original: I'll have the guards provide this captain soft beds and warm meals - small mercy for what he must endure.
string: 我会让守卫给这位船长提供柔软的床铺和热腾腾的饭菜--对于他必须承受的一切,这只是微不足道的怜悯.

original: Do you still miss Torygg often?
string: 你还经常想念托伊格吗?

original: I do, everyday. Of all the souls in Skyrim, he was one of the few who respected me, treated me with honor.
string: 是的,每一天.在天际省的所有灵魂中,他是少数几个尊重我,以礼相待的人之一.

original: I did not have to be the greatest leader or the most refined lady. Before him, I could be my true self - freely and guiltlessly.
string: 我不必成为最伟大的领袖,也无需做最优雅的淑女.在他面前,我可以自由而无愧地做真实的自己.

original: Since his passing... time stretched endlessly. My voice was silent when I spoke, my own reflection was a stranger's, as I checked the mirror.
string: 自从他离世后......时间变得漫无尽头.我开口说话时,声音却一片死寂;当我望向镜中,自己的倒影竟如同陌路之人.

original: Do you still feel that? Your voice being silent and your reflection foreign.
string: 你还能感受到吗?你的声音沉寂,你的倒影陌生.

original: I do not. Out here, in this new world - I feel more real than I ever was, even if my very face is an illusion to everyone besides us.
string: 我并不喜欢.在这个新世界里,我感觉比以往任何时候都更真实,即使我的面容对除我们之外的所有人而言都是一种幻象.

original: Do you feel like yourself when you're with me?
string: 和我在一起时,你是否感觉像真正的自己?

original: I do. Strange, isn't it? Having lost your own self for so long, then finding it again in an alien world.
string: 是的.这很奇妙,不是吗?在异世界中迷失自我许久,却又重新找回.

original: But sooner or later, you have to return to the court.
string: 但你迟早得回到宫廷里去.

original: And wear the mask again, lest the nobles point their judging fingers at me - as if they didn't already behind my back?
string: 再戴上这面具吧,免得那些贵族对我指指点点--好像他们背地里就没这么干过似的?

original: I could stay out here, forget about the court, let the nobles argue to no ends before that illusion on the throne.
string: 我可以留在这里,忘却宫廷,让贵族们在王座上的幻影前无休止地争论.

original: You could stay out here with me if it makes you happy.
string: 如果你觉得开心,可以留在这里陪我.

original: Yes... I will be happy. For awhile.
string: 是的......我会快乐的.暂时如此.

original: But when I see my kingdom desolated, with a queen who had deserted her... I will only weep.
string: 但当我看到我的王国荒芜,王后也已弃它而去......我只能流泪.

original: I guess we have to go our separate ways in the end.
string: 我想我们终究还是要分道扬镳.

original: Unless you intend to stay as the Royal Guardian, watching your queen every moment. I'm sure Bolgeir would appreciate the competition.
string: 除非你打算一直担任皇家护卫,时刻守护你的女王.我相信博尔盖尔会欢迎这样的竞争.

original: But, yes. Sooner or later, we'll say our farewells.
string: 但是,没错.我们迟早会道别的.

original: If you have to go back, then I want to go with you. (Romance)
string: 如果你必须回去,那我也想和你一起走.(浪漫)

original: As much as I'd love that... You have your path, and it leads to all the corners in this world.
string: 虽然我多么希望如此......但你有你的路,它通向这世界的每一个角落.

original: It would be selfish of me to keep you in a palace, rob you of your adventures, just for you to listen to the nobles squabble till the day's end.
string: 把你困在宫殿里,剥夺你的冒险机会,只为了让你整天听贵族们争吵,这对我来说太自私了.

original: But it worked for Torygg and you, didn't it?
string: 但这方法对托伊格和你都有效,不是吗?

original: Torygg was... different. He was born into that life.
string: 托伊格...不一样.他生来就注定要过那样的生活.

original: But you are meant for the world, not just for a palace - not just for me.
string: 但你生来属于这个世界,而非囿于一座宫殿--更非只为我一人.

original: One day, I'll retire from my adventures, settle down. We can share that future.
string: 终有一天,我会结束冒险生涯,安定下来.我们可以共享那样的未来.

original: Your word is all I need. Years, decades - I will await you in the Blue Palace, then we'll face Skyrim together, as her protectors.
string: 我只需你一言为定.无论年岁几何,我将在蓝宫等候,届时我们将并肩守护天际.

original: We could exchange our vows before Mara on this day. Private, simple, just for the two of us - no tedious rites and unwanted guests. Are you prepared?
string: 我们可以在今天向玛拉立下誓言.私密,简单,只属于我们两人--没有繁琐的仪式和多余的宾客.你准备好了吗?

original: I know I can't replace Torygg, but a life with you is what I truly want.
string: 我知道我无法取代托伊格,但与你共度此生才是我真正的心愿.

original: You're right. Torygg helped me find my place in Skyrim, and I will never forget him...
string: 你说得对.托伊格帮我找到了在天空省的归属,我永远不会忘记他......

original: But you - you helped me find myself. Not just the lovestruck girl that I was, but also the Queen that I could become.
string: 但你--你帮助我找回了自我.不仅是那个曾经陷入爱河的少女,更是那个我能够成为的女王.

original: In these brief times we've spent together, it's as if I've witnessed stories of ten lifetimes, and you were in all of them.
string: 在这短暂的相处时光里,我仿佛见证了十世轮回的故事,而每一世都有你的身影.

original: I... I don't think I can ever imagine a story without you, anymore.
string: 我......我已经无法想象没有你的故事了.

original: Alas, we must still walk different paths in the end...
string: 唉,我们终究还是得走上不同的道路......

original: True... That is true, indeed.
string: 确实......这确实是真的.

original: One day, I will return to Solitude without you... But I'll never forget the things I've learned, and the time we've had together.
string: 终有一日,我将独自回到独孤城......但我永远不会忘记所学到的一切,以及我们共度的时光.

original: But that day has not arrived yet, for I still have much to learn out here. Now, shall we?
string: 但那天尚未到来,因为我仍有许多需要在此学习.现在,我们开始吧?

original: So, we're finally married.
string: 那么,我们终于结婚了.

original: Yes, we are. Although the court is yet to be informed.
string: 是的,我们确实如此.尽管法庭尚未得知.

original: What if they disapprove?
string: 如果他们不同意呢?

original: Can they? Even for powerful Thanes like Erikur, there are forces they dare not transgress.
string: 他们能吗?即便是像艾瑞库尔这样强大的领主,也有他们不敢逾越的势力.

original: For instance, the Goddess of Love, her temple, and their own High Queen.
string: 例如,爱之女神,她的神殿,以及她们自己的至高女王.

original: Is it wise to elope like this?
string: 这样私奔明智吗?

original: It's the only way we can join as one. Had Solitude's court gotten in our way, they would bind me to a lordling and make him my leash.
string: 这是我们唯一能合为一体的方式.若独孤城的宫廷从中作梗,他们就会将我束缚给某个贵族子弟,让他成为我的枷锁.

original: But now it's done, and no protest of theirs will break us apart. I am yours, and you are mine.
string: 但现在木已成舟,他们的任何反对都无法将我们分开.我是你的,你是我的.

original: I just feel like we deserved a royal wedding.
string: 我只是觉得我们值得一场盛大的皇家婚礼.

original: Oh? And here I thought you liked my idea to have it private and simple.
string: 哦?我还以为你会喜欢我私下简办的提议呢.

original: Well, even if you hadn't asked for it, I'm sure the Thanes would demand a grand royal wedding just to salvage Solitude's pride.
string: 好吧,就算你没提,我相信领主们也会要求举办一场盛大的皇家婚礼,就为了挽回独孤城的颜面.

original: What better occasions to get drunk and stuffed?
string: 还有什么比这更适合喝醉吃撑的场合呢?

original: So - what will I become? High King? Prince-Consort? Or just Thane?
string: 那么--我会成为什么?至高王?亲王配偶?还是仅仅是个领主?

original: Oh, my, aiming for the titles already? You'll fit in fine in my court.
string: 哎呀,这么快就盯上爵位了?你倒是很适合待在我的宫廷里.

original: As I will become the ruling High Queen, I believe your title will be Prince-Consort. But honestly, most people will be happy enough to call you King.
string: 既然我将成为统治一方的至高女王,我认为你的头衔会是亲王配偶.但说实话,大多数人会很乐意称你为国王.

original: Oh, my, aiming for the titles already? You'll fit in fine in my court.
string: 哎呀,这么快就盯上爵位了?你倒是很适合待在我的宫廷里.

original: A marriage of our nature was unprecedented among royalty, but I'm sure we'll manage. Say, "Vice-Queen" does seem like an excellent title!
string: 我们这种性质的婚姻在王室中前所未有,但我相信我们能处理好.说起来,"副女王"这个头衔听起来确实很不错!

original: So - what will I become? Vice-Queen? Princess-Consort? Or just Thane?
string: 那么--我会成为什么?副女王?王妃?还是仅仅做个领主?

original: When will you inform them?
string: 你什么时候通知他们?

original: When I've cemented my authority as the High Queen. With your help, naturally.
string: 当我巩固了作为至高女王的权威时.当然,是在你的帮助下.

original: Meanwhile, I'll also try to help you gain a political foothold in Solitude.
string: 同时,我也会试着帮你在独孤城站稳政治脚跟.

original: Compelling the Thanes to acknowledge us is one thing, but we can still work to earn their genuine acceptance.
string: 迫使领主们承认我们是一回事,但我们仍可以努力赢得他们真正的接纳.

original: I'll teach you how to stay hidden and move silently.
string: 我来教你如何保持隐蔽并悄无声息地移动.

original: That could save my life.
string: 这或许能救我一命.

original: Holding my breath is the hardest part.
string: 屏住呼吸是最难的部分.

original: They won't know what hit them.
string: 他们连自己怎么死的都不知道.

original: You and Elisif share a quick, yet gentle kiss.
string: 你与艾莉西弗短暂而轻柔地一吻.

original:
Elisif just became more hardened or tempered.

As Elisif's guardian and mentor, you can direct her to become a more hardened or tempered ruler through dialogues or actions. These will shape her personality as a future queen and even affect her combat skills.

A hardened Elisif will lean closer towards Martial and Intrigue. A tempered Elisif will lean closer towards Diplomacy and Learning.
string: 艾莉西弗刚刚变得更加坚韧或沉稳. 作为艾莉西弗的守护者和导师,你可以通过对话或行动引导她成为一位更坚韧或更沉稳的统治者.这些将塑造她作为未来女王的个性,甚至影响她的战斗技能. 坚韧的艾莉西弗会更倾向于军事与谋略.沉稳的艾莉西弗会更倾向于外交与学识.

original:
Diplomacy is associated with Speech, where her noble presence improves your speech skill.
Martial is associated with her own One-Handed, Block, Heavy Armor.
Intrigue is associated with her own Archery, Sneak, Light Armor.
Learning is associated with her own Alteration, Destruction, Restoration.

In other words, the more you direct Elisif to be intrigue-minded, the better she will perform as an archer.
string: 外交与口才相关,她的贵族气质能提升你的口才技能. 军事关联她自身的单手武器,格挡和重甲技能. 谋略关联她自身的箭术,潜行和轻甲技能. 学识关联她自身的变化系,毁灭系和恢复系法术. 换言之,你越是引导艾利西弗偏向谋略思维,她作为弓箭手的表现就会越出色.
